data.title: Our Work
data.text:
Below are statistics for the Lifetime Senate Scores (103rd-114th Congresses). Read the related press release "The Lugar Center and Georgetown University's McCourt School Unveil New Bipartisan Index Rankings of All U.S. Senators."

Ten Highest Bipartisan Index Scores for a Single Congress:

Gordon Smith 110th 2.718033

Olympia Snowe 111th 2.637516

Lincoln Chafee 109th 2.60232

Susan Collins 114th 2.54734

Susan Collins 108th 2.352347

Lincoln Chafee 107th 2.160978

Gordon Smith 109th 2.122527

Lincoln Chafee 108th 2.120901

Susan Collins 113th 2.116206

Richard Lugar 111th 2.102551

Ten Lowest Bipartisan Scores for a Single Congress:

Jim DeMint 112th -2.09564

Jim DeMint 110th -2.03566

Bernie Sanders 114th -2.01024

Dan Coats 112th -2.00828

Ron Johnson 112th -2.00491

Rand Paul 112th -1.90618

Paul Coverdell 104th -1.86891

Jim DeMint 111th -1.84915

Mike Lee 112th -1.81647

Tim Scott 113th -1.7426

Party Distribution of Top 25 Lifetime Senate Scores:

15 Republicans

9 Democrats

1 Party Switcher

Party Distribution of Top 50 Lifetime Senate Scores:

27 Republicans

21 Democrats

2 Party Switchers

Party Distribution of Top 100 Lifetime Senate Scores:

49 Democrats

48 Republicans

3 Party Switchers

Party Distribution of Bottom 25 Lifetime Senate Scores:

17 Republicans

8 Democrats

Party Distribution of Bottom 50 Lifetime Senate Scores:

29 Republicans

21 Democrats

Party Distribution of Bottom 100 Lifetime Senate Scores:

51 Democrats

49 Republicans

Most Congresses with a Bipartisan Index Score in the Senate Top 10:

7 – Susan Collins

7 – Chuck Grassley

6 – Olympia Snowe

5 – Kent Conrad

4 – Lincoln Chafee

4 – Jim Jeffords

3 – John Breaux

3 – John Chafee

3 – Thad Cochran

3 – Pete Domenici

3 – Joe Lieberman

3 – Mark Kirk

3 – Richard Lugar

3 – Joe Manchin

3 – Lisa Murkowski

3 – Gordon Smith

Distribution of Senate Lifetime Scores for Those Serving in the 115th Congress:

56 below 0.00

36 above 0.00

8 new senators without a Lifetime Score

Highest Lifetime Scores Among Senators Serving at Least 5 Congresses since 1993:

Susan Collins 1.67026

Olympia Snowe 1.46238

Gordon Smith 1.35019

Chuck Grassley 1.06305

Jim Jeffords 0.94121

Lowest Scores Among Senators Serving at Least 5 Congresses since 1993:

Jesse Helms -1.03719

Dan Coats -1.02796

Bob Menendez -0.9241

Phil Gramm -0.89625

John Barrasso -0.8592

Highest Scores Among Senators Serving at Least 10 Congresses since 1993:

Susan Collins 1.670263

Chuck Grassley 1.045719

Kent Conrad 0.687046

Richard Lugar 0.667979

Joe Lieberman 0.662165

Lowest Scores Among Senators Serving at Least 10 Congresses since 1993:

Barbara Boxer -0.66381

Jim Inhofe -0.63906

Richard Shelby -0.56566

Patty Murray -0.42266

Dick Durbin -0.24125

States with All Lifetime Senate Scores Above 0.00:

Maine

Nevada

North Dakota

States with All Lifetime Senate Scores below 0.00:

California

Hawaii

New Jersey

Wyoming

State with “Highest Lowest” Senate Lifetime Score:

North Dakota - Byron Dorgan 0.34991 (all other states had at least one Senator with a lower lifetime score than any Senator from North Dakota)

State with the “Lowest Highest” Senate Lifetime Score:

Hawaii - Daniel Akaka -0.19249 (All other states had at least one Senator with a higher lifetime score than any Senator from Hawaii)
